overview_of_class: This intermediate/advanced technique class focuses on improving alignment, building strength, and increasing whole body awareness and dexterity within and through the codified exercises and enchainment of classical ballet. In the progression from barre to center, the class encourages the discovery and understanding of the anatomy and kinesiology involved in the sound execution of classical movements and positions and a rigorous engagement of mind and body in the quest towards physical virtuosity and performance presence. The class also looks at the ways in which classical ballet technique can inform and be informed by other modes of contemporary dance training.
name: Ballet III

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Only available to students who place into Level III in the fall placement class or receive permission from the instructor.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The goal is to understand how to use alignment, timing, shifting of weight, coordination, and the kinesthetic feeling from ballet for each dancer's own purposes, be it contemporary ballet, music theatre, or general well being.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Tight-fitting dance attire (i.e. leotards and tights) and ballet shoes are required.

Required book:
"Classical Ballet Technique" by Gretchen W. Warren
ISBN: 0-8130-0945-6
